description: Introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty. This course is for BE majors ONLY, with preference given to BSE students.
name: PRECEPTORSHIP IN CLIN BE

values.comments: This course is an introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty.   Students found this course to be very useful, as it exposed them to the various applications of engineering in the medical field. Almost all students shared the opinion that the most valuable part of this class was the preceptorship. They described this experience as “educational” and “enjoyable.” One student went so far as to say that the preceptorship was one of the “most memorable academic experiences to date.” Aside from the preceptorship, most students did not find the in-class lectures to be as interesting and fulfilling.   Students were generally not very pleased with Professor Eckmann. Many described him as “condescending” and “arrogant.” They also thought that Professor Eckmann was not very clear in his instructions when he assigned essay topics.   Students reported that this course required a lot of work, especially when lectures and essays were joined with work for the preceptorship. In addition, students felt that Professor Eckmann graded papers subjectively. This class is only open for BE juniors and seniors.
